items.title: Trump's Tariffs Could Spark Reshoring Boom For These 4 US Stocks
items.author: Erica Kollmann
items.description: Trump's tariffs are expected to lead to investments in domestic manufacturing and companies reshoring their supply chains. This could benefit companies like Caterpillar, Rockwell Automation, Eaton, and Fastenal.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Caterpillar, the world's largest manufacturer of construction equipment, could benefit from a domestic construction boom due to reshoring efforts.
Rockwell Automation, a pure-play industrial automation company, could see an increase in demand for its factory floor-level devices if large-scale industrial reshoring occurs.

Eaton Corporation, an aerospace systems provider and data center technology innovator, is positioned to capitalize on both tariff-related industrial modernization and the AI revolution's escalating power needs.
Fastenal, a distributor of construction, industrial, and safety supplies, could see a boost if companies begin to reshore manufacturing and industrial supply chains.
